Google.text: King Shing is KING OF CHINESE FOOD! I have been a faithful customer since they opened. Moved out of state, returned and their quality, value and kindness (stop in one day!) is STILL second to none. There's a REASON why they're the KING! King Shing is KING OF CHINESE FOOD!

I ordered the hot and spicy shrimp today. I think it was really good and the shrimp was really tender. I never had this good Chinese food in a while so I enjoyed it. I think the dish was more sweet than it was spicy. But still I enjoyed it and I recommend this restaurant.

Solid strip mall Chinese takeout. This location is convenient for anyone on the southeast side of Ann Arbor, north Pittsfield Township and far west Ypsilanti, and the service has always been very good, but the food used to be only passable with most dishes being overly sweet. The food has changed, for the better in my opinion. This review will likely be updated in a few months as I plan to go back at least a couple of times over the next month or so.

Ordered pepper steak and chicken fried rice for take out and it was ready under 10 minutes! Food was hot and delicious. The lady at the front was using a baby sound monitor to hear the customer better which I thought was ingenious.

These people don’t care about quality or customer service. Twice now we ordered on DoorDash and received sweet-and-sour chicken with no sauce. Basically glorified chicken nuggets. And when we complained they laughed and thought it was funny. We overlooked it the first time, but the second time was the final straw. Will never order from here again.

Google.text: Spicy Beef Noodle soup is delicious and full of beef flavor and chunks of delicious beef. Large enough to share and still get separate orders of dumplings. This place is a hidden gem!

Dumplings are always hot and delicious. The egg and spring rolls lack flavor and the spring roll was a bit mushy the last two times I got them. The chicken with garlic is the only dish I've ever eaten from here and it was fine, just an excessive amount of sauce.  I love to get my dumplings from here for soup when I dont have time to make my own. This is the only place I will get them from. Definitely worth a trip.

Food was OK, B maybe even B+, but that is probably the only thing acceptable about this place.
First, the environment. Too cramped, they put twice the amount of tables the place could hold. Familiar with really tight booth? Get ready for the tiniest booth in town. Sticky table? Check. Non-matching silverware? Check. The chopsticks we were give could not stop rolling. Chipped plates? Check.
Second, service. Ever being served appetizer 25 minutes after all other entries? Get ready for such an experience. Order things you want the most from the menu? " Sorry, we are out of most the stuff because we are closed on Monday". That totally makes you question when were the food made. Last Monday, Maybe.  If you don't think this is a red flay, I have nothing for you.

Update:
They changed the tip amount on my credit card bill. I am not sure if that is a crime, but sure not ethical.

I had the shrimp/chicken dumplings. The dumplings were wonderful. However the dump(restaurant), not so much! After eating, l went to the bathoom.  l made the mistake of touching the doorknob. The knob and door were black. Quite literally caked with years of FILTH! I may have gotten the corona virus (or the Spanirh Flu, or Bubonic plague--depending how many decades it has been since the door was cleaned). 5 stars for the food. a minus 9 stars for the horrible and painful death l will endure for touching anything in the building!
Amazing. Fantastic. Wonderful. Delicious food, very friendly staff. I got 20 dumplings made to order in less than 10 minutes. They were so good that I had them eaten in only 15.

Google.text: Never order on any holiday as your food will take hours, if it ever gets made. Also, I cannot recommend the Americanized Chinese menu. That being said, the traditional menu is delicious and consistent. One of the best options in the area.

I went in today with my girlfriend and I ordered the Stewed Fish in rice wine sauce and she got the Beef Wide Noodles. The fish was very tender and the rice wine sauce went very well with the delicate fish, the wood ear that was in the stew was also very delicious and had a great crunch. My girlfriend liked the beef wide noodles and says it is her favorite dish from the restaurant now. She is new to Chinese food and the texture of the noodles in this particular dish was new and exciting for her. Overall 10/10 experience and I will be coming back with her to try new dishes and the bubble teas

I cannot remeber ever having a better meal at a Chinese Restaurant. The service was great. The atmosphere was great. The food was not only delicious but top quality as well. We stopped there because we were in the area but I will make a special trip and drive the distance to eat there again.

I have been eating and getting takeout at Evergreen since the pandemic started and they haven’t declined in the quality of the food or service in these hard times. I really appreciate how they have only been working harder for the community and their customers. I wish the staff of evergreen the best and hope we can keep on supporting them and their business.

I hadn't been here in years. They doubled the size and completely remodelled it so it looks sharp and modern. Nice vibe, nice staff and good food. I saw a lot of Chinese people eating here so I take that as a sign that the food is authentic and meets the expectations of a sophisticated and worldly Chinese expat community.

Responsive waiter and constantly checking on us! They include 18% tip automatically.

Fast service: you don’t wait for your dishes. BUT, it is a *very typical Chinese-American restaurant*: very sweet, oily, too much sauces to fit American flavor. I won’t suggest to go there if you are looking for something authentic: better cook by yourself.

The taste is bad. The service is even worse. If you don't care about the taste and service at all and just want to throw your money away, this is your place. Be careful with everything, otherwise you will be lectured by the waitress "kindly". This is the first time I got questioned by a waitress "What is wrong with you? Don't you understand?" How can you talk to me like that while expecting me to tip you? They would also keep checking on you in case you get too comfortable. An epic experience I will never forget. Now I'm feeling throw up not only because of the greasy food, but also in deep regret of my decision to come here.

Btw, tipping is not mandatory in the United States. Just so the owner know.

Their service quality fluctuates and sometimes the owner's attitude/behavior makes you feel disrespected. One time, I rushed in the restaurant ordering a takeout bento, bumped into a big table with friends, I then sat down and asked for permission to eat my takeout box. I was granted approval. I was only there for about 15 mins, but then when checkout, the restaurant owner murmured to me that she's doing me a huge favor & there won't be any exceptions for eating takeout box indoors next time. Experiences as such make this restaurant unforgettable - otherwise, it does provides relatively delicious Chinese food in downtown Ann Arbor.

Their food reminds me of home and I don’t know what more I could ask for. Korean Fried Chicken was crispy with a lot of meat on each wing and the duck noodle broth was so rich and savory. They had me hooked with their fantastic food but I became a customer for life after I asked about buying one of their t-shirts and they made it happen! Please support this hard-working and local, family-owned business.

Would recommend you try the Hot Pepper Oil Noodle with Chicken or whatever looks good, everything tastes good so you can’t go wrong. 10/10 and 5 Stars.

Google.text: The place is clean, portions are generous and the price is reasonable. We particularly liked the squirrel fish (with sweet and sour sauce) and the ice jelly with brown sugar, which is light and refreshing after a spicy meal. On the other hand, although the dry pot cauliflower was fresh and crispy, it was relatively salty for our taste. We are not from Sichuan, so perhaps this is authentically how it is supposed to be. However, for us, we will ask them to be gentle on the salt (and also chilies) next time. There was only one waitress when we were there, so please be patient if you visit, nevertheless she was very friendly and attentive. The restaurant is rather far from where we live, but definitely worth the journey!

I absolutely love coming to YP Sichuan every time I’m in the area. Super friendly and sweet staff, very helpful. All of the vegetarian options are amazing! I love taking my vegan friends here. This is some of the best chinese food in the area, especially for folks that don’t eat meat!

Google.text:
Agree with some previous posts.  Long time customer and yes, my family is asian and have lived extensively in Taiwan and China so we've been to countless hand made noodle bars.

The knife cut noodles here used to be really good, thin, and consistent (slightly thicker than fettuccine) when they first opened but over the past year been back 4 to 5 times and had several family members regret ordering the knife cut every time (some were literally the thickness of a standard Lego brick), hoping that it was just a fill in chef.  Food quality and taste has definitely taken a hard turn from what it once was.

I'll continue to try it once in a while in hopes that the quality improves because it is unique and super delicious if the restaurant is managed correctly, but for now I'm open to trying other noodle shops.

Food was delicious! Only downside was that my dumplings were packed in a very small to-go container so they kind of melded together and that made them difficult to eat. But still flavorful! Food was hot and fresh, which I really appreciated. Will order again👍

I'm from Atlanta and the noodle shops there can't compete. Unfortunately they are only offering take out at the moment, but the food was still totally amazing. The portion size and quality shocked me at that price point. I recommend the hot pepper oil noodle if you like spicy food.

I don't understand how this restaurant is SO good. I always get the Hot Pepper Oil Noodles and it's one of my favourite meals of all time. Perfectly spicy, fantastic hand pulled noodles, some of the best tofu. Makes incredible leftovers, too!

This place is serious quality for a very reasonable price. The noodles and broth were amazing in the Duck Noodle soup! The curry samosas were also a huge hit with the chutney complementing the flavor profile perfectly. First time going but I suspect this place will become a regular spot!

Google.text: Grabbed drinks & dinner with a friend after work, we sat at the bar. Drinks & the food I had was pretty good! I do have a gluten allergy, I was shocked that they had all of this pasta & pizza but no gluten free options for either of them. Pizza crust & pasta are some of the "easiest" things to make gluten free. Being an Italian restaurant, Italy has a million gluten free options within their dining. With food allergies & peoples intolerances, this place should really be more inclusive to those who need this dietary restriction. Especially being in Ann Arbor. Wish they would have this option as everything sounded great, just not options for all which was extremely disappointing.

Google.text:
I had been waiting to go to Aventura for years, hearing good things from friends and coworkers, and finally found time to go. The biggest thing that I had heard from friends was to stick to the tapas and skip the paella. As a paella fan, I decided that I needed to try it. This proved to be a mistake

We got the Valentine's Day menu, which included a few tapas (you don't get to choose), and the lobster paella, followed by a dessert.

One thing to note here is that the drinks and wine selection are really excellent. Can't fault them there.

The tapas we received were really disappointing. The bruschetta tasted like the tomatoes came from a can, there was another forgettable vegetarian dish, and the third dish was a fried cheese dish. On the whole,  definitely nothing to write home about.

The most unfortunate portion of the entire meal was the lobster paella. The rice in the paella was mostly flavorless, the calamari was decent, but the lobster was extremely overcooked. I've never had lobster this dry. It was a real shame.

The dessert was some chocolate souffle, fine but also forgettable.

For the price, the quality of food is not there. Aventura is all form and no function. It's regrettable because the space is gorgeous and I really wanted to like the food. Spanish food is really fantastic. I've been to Spain. I've had Tapas. It's really not that difficult to do well. Aventura simply was not. I hope that they can work to improve their menu because they are onto a good concept, just severely lacking in execution.

Right away the brick wall with moss sets the tone for a great night out. Our waiter was knowledgable and friendly and steered us towards the paella. We ordered the paella, which was delicious, and our favourite was the octopus. The goat cheese and pineapple dish was also very good. The drinks were fantastic and strong. This was a great restaurant for an anniversary dinner!

The food is absolutely excellent here! Especially the churros with the chocolate and caramel sauce (I think it was caramel). I like that it’s tapas style but you gotta make sure to have lots of money with you to go here because it is not cheap! Seriously you can easily rack up a high bill just off of appetizers. Overall I will highly recommend this restaurant!!

The good: the food presentation is on point. Everything looks great, you eat with your eyes first and this place delivers. The food came out on time, and the service was great. All of the tapas we had were really good.

The not so good: I did have a little shell in my crab dish I know it happens sometimes, but for the price of this I expect closer to perfection. Our table had 3 paella, 2 of them were great, the third fell flat and was left largely untouched, which went overlooked, no offer to exchange or remove the $70 plate of rice.

The bad: Price. Man, I've been to Spanish tapas places all over, and I'd never call them budget friendly bites, but our bill for 2 people was $340 after tax & tip. The other couples in our party were in the same ballpark. That's without bottles of wine. At half that price I'm a little bummed but I'd go back. I'm not sure I'll be back.

Great food and drinks, I would like to come back with an empty stomach for their paellas. Would recommend and definitely go back. Minor hitch - there was no hostess for about 6 minutes since we arrived. But she quickly took care of us once she was back.

My family used to come to this location all the time growing up and we loved it. The food was good,. the service was good, and they packed both floors.
We haven't been in years and were reminiscing as a family and wanted to return. The place was empty, the service was offensively bad, and the food sub par. My father ordered baked spaghetti and was brought a plate of plain pasta. They acted like he was crazy when he questioned it. They DID NOT FIX IT. They just played it off like we were crazy for expecting that baked food would be baked. We left without making scene, but we will never return to this washed up joke of a restaurant.

I've been coming to Cottage Inn my whole life. In the University of Michigan Men's Glee Club, we come here every Thursday night. Truly a special place! Best pizza in town (dare I say, in the state?), friendly staff and managers (Lorenzo!!!), and a lovely ambiance. It's a must-do every time I'm in Ann Arbor.

Hosted a luncheon following a funeral downtown. The staff were flexible and pleasant even though we had undercounted expected guests, so they had to scramble to feed and set places for the additional guests. The food was so yummy and hot, and exactly what we needed. Salads were fresh and the green beans were crisp tender. The teens especially enjoyed the fresh hot pizza although a lot of "grown ups" also loved it! The setting was comfortable. It's not "fancy Italian" but classic and over the years, their quality has not diminished. We will recommend to anyone.

Best Pizza in town, we lived in Ann Arbor for a year back in ‘95 just around the corner on Thompson, this place is awesome. Definitely one of the best not only in town but in entire States. Every now and then when we visit Ann Arbor the only spot we eat pizza.

Google.text: Good food & good ambience. I ordered cutlery board which had had meat, cheese, fruits, bread and jam. Service was very nice. One of our favorite spots in downtown A2! Great selection of beverages and a spot you can stop in for a single drink, or stay for a couple. Lots of parking within walking distance. Wine tastings if you really want to make an event out of it!

Terrible service, below average food.

I had taken my wife here for her birthday dinner. Less of a dinner, and more of some cocktails and a couple appetizers, to the disappointment of our server. Unfortunately it's been a month or two so I cannot remember his name. We declined any entrees, and so he proceeded to get the dessert menu, making it sound like we would receive a complimentary dessert for my wife's birthday. That wasn't the case, which is fine. We looked over the desserts and didn't see anything we wanted. When we told our waiter, he proceeded to slam his hand on the table, crumple our menu, and walk away. He said something, trying to act like it was a joke, but jokes or not, nothing justifies this kind of behavior. All night it seemed like we were an inconvenience since we only ordered a couple things instead of 5 courses, meaning his tip would be small.

As far as the food goes, we just got cocktails and a charcuterie, which were both fine, but nothing good to write home about. The food seemed like something that marketed itself as a fine dining experience, but really was just Chili's with some makeup on. Especially with how we were treated dining there.

The brunch was excellent - I wish the bottomless mimosas were a little less expensive as $20 is quite a lot so I just opted for a single mimosa. I would suggest additional breakfast cocktails, such as Irish coffee or spiked hot cocoa. The staff were fast and friendly and the restaurant (and bathrooms) were clean and comfortable. We definitely enjoyed our meal and would return for brunch or any special meal at Vinology!

Vinology is always top-notch. The food was delicious, unique, and timely. We have loved every experience we've ever had at Vinology, and last night was no different. Probably our favorite restaurant in Ann Arbor!

Google.text: This is one of new favorite spots and has filled a void in the vegan pizza market. The pizza is delightful and there are lots of options to build your own. We’re not big fans of processed vegan cheese, so we love that they offer almond ricotta. Their fries and ranch are excellent, too. We’ll be coming back!

We ordered TONS of food for under $100! Portions are hugeeee. The food is fresh and delicious! If you aren’t vegan you will still love it. Such a great idea for a local restaurant.

The food is great, but the wait times are too much. We ordered a pizza at 430 today and were told that it would be ready at 530. Just before picking it up we were told it would be about another 25 minutes. When I went back to pick it up, I was told another 6-7 minutes. It was ready at about 615, so it was close to 2 hours after ordering for a single pizza. We've had some order accuracy issues here and there, but it's the difficulty with getting an accurate pickup time that makes us hesitant to keep ordering from here.

I am really sad to have to leave a negative a review of this restaurant.  We were very excited about it because my daughter is dairy intolerant.  The food was good, nothing special.  You do get a lot of food.  But, they are very dishonest about the wait times.  We were told 35 to 40 minutes.  I arrived at 6:35pm (exactly 35 minutes), figuring I might have to wait another 5 minutes or so.  When I came in, they first had me sign the credit card receipt and then told me it would be another 15-20 minutes.  I told the staff person that it would be good to be honest to begin with about the wait times.  About 15 minutes later they called me up again and told me it would be yet another 15 to 20 minutes.  They didn’t have my food ready until just before 7:30pm - I waited almost 55 minutes at the restaurant.  While I was there, others came in and said the restaurant had called them to let them know it would be a longer wait (total of an hour).  We were never called.  After they had them pay their bills, they then told these other customers that they would also wait another 15 to 20 minutes.  It was interesting that they were clearly making sure they got payment BEFORE telling the customers they would need to wait addition time for their food.  The whole thing was very dishonest.  This was not the only issue we had.  We ordered my daughter’s meal specifically with “just pesto and pasta, nothing else.”  This was reiterated several times on the phone and we were told that would not be a problem to do.  When I got home with the food, my daughter’s pasta had ricotta and mozzarella vegan cheese on top of it - even though the lid stated that it was “just pesto and pasta.”  How can a person write that while looking at the meal and seeing that it clearly had addition ingredients on it?  We are all very disappointed with our experience.  All they had to do was be honest up front about the wait times.  We would not have been upset that they were busy and had long wait times, if they had been honest about it.

In response to the owners:  I was told that the reason for the long wait time was that the online system was down and that the restaurant was very busy.  Another customer was told the same thing.  At no point did anyone mention an injured chef.  Again, honesty is always the best way to go.  Clearly if we had been told a chef had been injured, we would have been much more understanding of the situation.  Even if it was the online system (which really doesn’t make sense), we would have been understanding.  It was the lack of honesty that was the issue and still is the issue.

I called door dash who talked to the restaurant, but they could not refund my money since the order was made through the restaurant’s website. I called the restaurant again and got a different person who told me the food was made and delivered. I told him what I and the driver were both previously told and, still insisting the order was delivered, he did refund the charge. Both restaurant employees were rather rude while telling me completely different stories. The door dash driver (who is now shorted his time and gas) and customer service representative were both polite, so there is that.

The chicken with garlic is the only dish I've ever eaten from here and it was fine, just an excessive amount of sauce.  I love to get my dumplings from here for soup when I dont have time to make my own. This is the only place I will get them from. Definitely worth a trip.

Food was OK, B maybe even B+, but that is probably the only thing acceptable about this place.
First, the environment. Too cramped, they put twice the amount of tables the place could hold. Familiar with really tight booth? Get ready for the tiniest booth in town. Sticky table? Check. Non-matching silverware? Check. The chopsticks we were give could not stop rolling. Chipped plates? Check.
Second, service. Ever being served appetizer 25 minutes after all other entries? Get ready for such an experience. Order things you want the most from the menu? " Sorry, we are out of most the stuff because we are closed on Monday". That totally makes you question when were the food made. Last Monday, Maybe.  If you don't think this is a red flay, I have nothing for you.

Update:

I may have gotten the corona virus (or the Spanirh Flu, or Bubonic plague--depending how many decades it has been since the door was cleaned). 5 stars for the food. a minus 9 stars for the horrible and painful death l will endure for touching anything in the building!

Tomukun is extraordinary. I was visiting the area from a major city, where we have nothing so good or affordable. The same bowl where I live would have been double the cost and not as good. I cannot recommend Tomukun enough for its authenticity and superior quality. The wait staff is very young—super nice, but some are maybe a little unskilled in paying attention to service. The egg was over cooked, the broth was yummy but maybe less strictly authentic, but the pork belly was perfect and everything was very balanced and fresh, well made. The space is small, but cozy. Really, the staff and space could have been awful and I’d still want to eat here every day. The steamed buns were perfect. The noodles were perfect. Ann Arbor is very lucky.

Agree with some previous posts.  Long time customer and yes, my family is asian and have lived extensively in Taiwan and China so we've been to countless hand made noodle bars.

The knife cut noodles here used to be really good, thin, and consistent (slightly thicker than fettuccine) when they first opened but over the past year been back 4 to 5 times and had several family members regret ordering the knife cut every time (some were literally the thickness of a standard Lego brick), hoping that it was just a fill in chef.  Food quality and taste has definitely taken a hard turn from what it once was.

I'll continue to try it once in a while in hopes that the quality improves because it is unique and super delicious if the restaurant is managed correctly, but for now I'm open to trying other noodle shops.

This place is serious quality for a very reasonable price. The noodles and broth were amazing in the Duck Noodle soup! The curry samosas were also a huge hit with the chutney complementing the flavor profile perfectly. First time going but I suspect this place will become a regular spot!

Little cute red house! Very friendly and passionate restaurant owner. He was constantly checking on us.

Fun menu with comments like “amazing” “terrific”

Nevertheless, I ordered the beef pad Thai, and it was overly sweet and sour. Too heavily flavored. I wished they could have added less salt and sauce.

The fried rangoons had interesting dumpling-like shape and were crispy.
Delicious Thai food in a warm & cozy atmosphere. We had the drunken noodles and the chicken with spicy basil sauce and mango sticky rice-- all were tasty. Slightly overpriced, but good service.

We live in Brighton area and weren't happy with local Thai restaurants so we
tried out Tuptim Thai.  We loved it!  We had 2 kinds of rolls, shrimp pad thai and honey chicken.  All were great!  We have now found our new go to for Thai food.
Very organized service, even during busy dinner time. When you call, your order is promptly brought outside. Staff is friendly and lots of vegan options. Online ordering system is easy and clear!

vietnamese.name: Of Rice & Men
vietnamese.address: 312 S Main St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104

Yelp.text:
It's giving big city ambiance. I was pleasantly impressed with the vibe as it feels out of place in Ann Arbor.

Enjoyed the spicy tuna crispy roll, which...
Former location of Melange. Very busy which was a good sign. Dim lighting, spacious dining area with a cool bar.  Must be short on staff because it took a...
I came back here for Valentine's Day with high expectations. I have to say this time was pretty bad. I started with the mango salad which was fishy tasting...

Google.text: Amazing culinary experience! One of our new favorites. Our server, David, was friendly, attentive, knowledgeable and helpful with suggestions. Food was some of the best we've had. Music was eclectic. Interior was comfortable modern Asian minimalistic but kinda cute. Did I mention the food was awesome!

This place is amazing! I've heard about it for awhile and finally made it on Valentines day. Their VDay special of a 5 course was excellent every course and my fiance and I can't stop talking about how much we enjoyed and want to eat more.  This place is top notch with their service, how efficient everything was and overall the quality and creativity of each dish. Ann Arbor has a new gem of a restaurant that may become my favorite soon! Must try!!
Delicious food and they're open late. Gorgeous aesthetically pleasing environment and entrees.. what more could a girl need

Great food with great portion sizes and the atmosphere and customer service was amazing. The only downside is that the rice in the food we ordered could have cooked a little bit more, but other than that excellent place that I would highly recommend.

I never write reviews but had to for Of Rice and Men!  The service was impeccable. I was there on February 12th and tried the tasting menu.  It was fantastic and worth the money.  Must haves are the crispy rice salad, and the duck!  I went back again on February 25th and tried the Tom Yum lobster and the short ribs. Both were excellent!  The manager and chef both came by to check on the table.  We never felt rushed and fully enjoyed the fine dining experience.  I will be back!

french.name: The Earle Restaurant
french.address: 121 W Washington St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104

Yelp.text: I've worked downtown for many years, but had never dined at the Earle until last night.  The atmosphere was as I expected with dim lighting and elegant...
This place has sent EBS emails about specials for years (I am in charge of his digital afterlife) so I have wanted to try it for a while. When the dinning...
What a meal! I regret not discovering this place sooner. The ambiance was upscale yet approachable, with live piano music, mood lighting, and some exposed...

Google.text:
I love this place, nice atmosphere and great service!

The sea scallops were fantastic, very tender and the sherry cream sauce is delicious.

Grilled salmon also very good! The wine, shallot, and lemon sauce was really good, I thought the sides for both dishes really complemented their entrees well.

Creme brulee was delicious as well! Overall we were very pleased!!

In Ann Arbor for a birthday getaway weekend.  We had an awesome experience at the Earle.  Service was good, food was excellent and the atmosphere was romantic.  We enjoyed the jazz music it was a wonderful addition to a nice evening.  Will definitely dine there again!

Family dinner here recently.  Son ordered medium rare ribeye and it was cooked perfectly.  One of the few times I have seen him take take a whole steak.  Wife and daughter ordered chicken and salmon, respectively.  Both loved their meal.  Drinks are a little pricey, but spectacularly made and well portioned.  Service was good, attentive, and present when desired.

Wine selection is amazing and reasonably priced. Food was outstanding. And the atmosphere is great. We especially liked the cork covered walls. It's more of a special occasion place and I'm certain we'll be back there.

Had the chicken saltimbocca and was blown away. My wife loved her 4 cheese crab pasta. The calamari app was light and airy and crispy, but there was no pepper rings or tentacles. I love the tentacles.
Had the Tiramisu for dessert. Second best I've ever had, the first being made by a friend's Italian grandmother who worked as a pastry chef.

Highly recommend.

french.name: Cafe Zola
french.address: 112 W Washington St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104

Yelp.text: We had a late reservation and had to wait a little longer because our table was not ready. We were with a group and found that the atmosphere was conducive...
This place is okay, but definitely way overpriced and there are a lot more solid options in the area that I always choose over here. The only reason why I...
We were in the Ann Arbor area for lunch and decided to stop in.  Glad we did.  We sat at the bar and received excellent service from Vance - she was...

Google.text: My coworkers and I had just gotten off night shift at the hospital and wanted to get breakfast to celebrate a new job for a coworker who was leaving soon. We arrived at 7:50 a.m. and proceeded to walk in to the open restaurant door.  One of the employees informed us that the restaurant was not open until 8 a.m. I inquired that since it was cold out, could we wait right inside the door. We were told no, which seemed a little unreasonable since the restaurant at that point would be opening in less than 10 minutes and since it was early Sunday morning there was not much else open nearby. We left and came back at 8. When we were seated,  we were a little disgusted to see that right under our table was a used mask and a dirty fork. We looked around the restaurant and saw another table had a crumpled up napkin on the floor. And a third table also had a mask under it. Since we were literally the first customers to come in, it is apparent that the floors had nor been cleaned at closing the day before.  Despite all this, we stayed and enjoyed our breakfast.  The food was good, although way overpriced especially considering the condition of the floors of the restaurant.  I would have expected more from a restaurant that charges that much for the food, which was only good, hardly great. Our waitress, however,  was attentive and prompt in her service.  Will have to seriously reconsider if I will patronize this establishment again.

My experience wasn't the best. My mother and I decided on Zola's for a late lunch. The waitress was very nice though. The food was room temp when it arrived. It was alright, but definitely not worth the money. Most importantly why would they have the janitor sweep and mop literally under our feet while we're trying to enjoy our meal. Not to mention he kept yelling at customers for using the restroom.

We waited over 45 minutes for our food. The muscle's were in a sauce that tasted like old, rancid socks and the steak wasn't a steak. I don't know what it was, some sort of shriveled up anomaly. Disgusting. Literally nasty. They gave me and my wife a mouthful of mediocre wine. We have wine at home, we should have brought it! A couple of loud, obnoxious hipsters were behind us and wouldn't stop yapping about harry potter! Keep in mind, I'm a seasoned 41 year old man with the patience of a precious stone. You don't want to crack this stone, or you'll get the shards.

staff here are always friendly & trying their hardest Even when it’s busy! So far I have gotten the monte Crisco twice if you have their lattes and some of their appetizers I have also gotten a spritzer and I have not been disappointed yet. Will definitely be coming back again in the future.

I used to love this place. I know they're struggling with staffing issues, but man, this was rough.

We came out at 3PM on a weekday, were one of the only two indoor tables that were occupied at the time, and it still took us 45+ mins to get our food. The mimosas tided us over a little, but our waitress barely checked in on us for refills, nor did she have much of a presence at all. She only refilled our drinks when our food finally came out nearly an hour later—my shakshuka's eggs were overcooked and so was the chicken on my mom's salad. Again, things would be different if they were busy, but there was no midday crowd (by the time we got our food we were the only occupied table indoors!) They started to mop right beside our table just as we finally began to eat, too, and the strong smell of bleach did nothing to help what was already mediocre food. Our waitress checked on us again only after we had finished our dishes to give us our check, and that was that.

I'm really sad. What was supposed to be a fun retread of an old favourite turned into a bill that was $90+ for two disappointing meals (with really small portions) and all around disappointing service. I want to come back, see they've improved, and write a better review because I don't want to see another A2 favourite leave town, but I'm not sure I'm ready to take that risk again. I hope they can read their reviews and see where they need to improve.

...At least the blood orange mimosas were good!

french.name: Spencer
french.address: 113 E Liberty St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104

Yelp.text: All I can say is that Spencer's is an experience that will leave you feeling classy, stuffed, and amazed all in one. Reservations open up on Thursday's at 4...
If you want to go out for a nice meal, Spencer is where you need to go! Friendly and knowledgeable staff, mind-blowing food, and a wonderful local feel. We...

Place
This place is such a nice ambience. The store is like a wine shop and you look around with a mask. Yay for covid friendly places

Service 
The service...

Google.text: Our small party of three had a wonderful dining experience at Spencer. It’s a bit like eating dinner at a friends house if your friends were award-winning chef’s. They do a good job of pairing wine with food here. The flavors of each entrée are bright, and the plating looks marvelous. We booked a reservation in advance, and you should too! It could be a little challenging getting indoor table space here, but we made it. Seating is community-style indoors, so you can keep to yourself with your own party or make friends with the party next to you. We were told that it was early in the season and the outdoor patio service will start soon.

The carryout meal I ordered was so fantastic. We ended up with 4 servings of food so it was well worth the price. The instructions for re-heating were perfect - our food came out perfectly. Not only was the food great, they had recommendations for wine to pair with the meal. We bought a bottle and a slice of cake. Overall, highly satisfied customer here! Will definitely be ordering take out again.

I usually don’t leave 5stars. Most excellent places are 4, but this place is exceptional. Went there about 1.5 months ago during labors day weekend with my boyfriend and his mom. Was so excited to try for a long time and it did not disappoint me! The presentation is fantastic, the talk they give for you is nice. The food, is of course so good. If you do $75 dinner option the portion is pretty huge, but it could depend on the time and menu, I guess? This is probably the only fine dining restaurant I can recommend to anyone who’d like to have a full experience and amazing dishes for special occasions. - and don’t forget grab some wines their selections are quite interesting even I don’t know much about wines could see how unique each wine is. Excited to visit them again for fall/winter menu!!

I have been here twice and the food is outstanding. The menu varies, but I have yet to try something that isn’t a celebration of flavor and texture. I have not found anything that compares, especially on price.
Incredibly helpful and knowledgeable staff. Amazing atmosphere

Yelp.text:
After living in Ann Arbor for over two years and passing this place weekly, we finally stopped in.  The space is huge and there are tons of tables.

The...
My first time here.  My chicken parmigiana receives mixed reviews. The chicken was over cooked to the point the breading was charred.  To their credit they...
My noodles were hard and the food was cold. My waitress was very kind though so nothing against the staff!

Google.text: I always enjoy the food I eat here, and I find it can be good inspiration for cooking at home! I like to see their seasonal changes to the menu. Most menu items are executed quite well.

Wonderful Italian restaurant!! One of my family’s favorites ever. The owner is often present and greets customers and the food is delicious! I do wish it were a bit cheaper so I could justify visiting more frequently, but it’s definitely worth it both for the food and atmosphere. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for higher end Italian cuisine.

You get what you expect,  no matter where you go.  Paesano, in its namesake,  derives inclusion and friendship.  The people here seem to genuinely have that mentality.  The owners are great.  The food is pretty good,  nothing wow really.  Prices are within reason given rising costs of everything and staffing shortages.
I really enjoyed this place and the meal. The food was superb and I bought a couple bottles of Italian wine to take home. I highly recommend Paesano's! You'll love the atmosphere too.
The staff was very friendly and food was excellent!

french.name: Zola Bistro

Yelp.text: The food was very average. Kinda pricey for what it is. We got the Shakshuka and waffle. The Shakshuka was not very flavorful. The inside decor was cute.

After two bad experiences. Decided Not going here anymore. 
Very bad service. Zero courteous, rolling eyes. Have to ask everything five times.. won't check...
Had a really disappointing experience here this morning for brunch and as a result I won't be returning. I had friends visiting from out of town and made us...

Google.text:
As someone who worked in the service industry, I’m empathetic towards an overwhelmed/busy staff. However that is absolutely not the case with Zola Bistro. I went there today (3/27) w/ a few people to celebrate a birthday (4 people total). We had a reservation for 12:30, a couple of us showed up early to set up. We were greeted by an incredibly rude hostess who scolded us for being 10 minutes ahead of time. It wasn’t like it was wall to wall w/ people desperately clawing for brunch, the entire front area was open. So, I sincerely apologize to the incompetent host for overwhelming you with a 4 top. Also, i apologizing for asking where the restroom was. I’m sure that was stressful/hard for you to answer while you were standing there ignoring calls :/

Today was my third visit to Cafe Zola & the other two experiences were no different. To whoever the hiring manager is, do better with who you’re selecting to represent/run a small business.

For those of you looking for a brunch place, don’t worry ! If the high prices for mediocre food were already deterring you, the inattentive waitstaff should add to it as well. Don’t go here !

My friends and I stopped here for brunch after hanging out in a hot tub. There were nothing but great vibes. It was slightly busy around 11 am but not too crowded during a pandemic. They accommodated our request not to sit by the door which is my preference wherever I go. Everyone enjoyed their food. We ordered quite a few items from the menu. I had the Smoked salmon omelette and potatoes with steak on the side. All of my food was delicious. We ordered the large crepe and waffles as our appetizer. It was a great experience. I will add that they should add turkey or beef breakfast meat options. But the steak was perfect!

The fifth star isn’t coming. Not soon. Paid $20 for one meal (spaghetti) and then another $20 ish dollars for salmon. Partner says the salmon is incredible. Best he’s ever had. Spaghetti was quite nice. But the portions are extremely small for such high prices. Unsure if I’ll come back. But worth one visit.

Food was cold when it came out. The potatoes were hard and the bacon was too hard so we sent it back. When the manager brought out fresh food it was much better. Had it not been for that I probably would have given them 4 stars. Bathroom was nice and clean, that's always a plus!

What is going on here? This place couldn't be further from the location downtown. Went here yesterday, had a 20 minute wait. Waited and shopped in the plaza. Wait took over 30 minutes, which is fine. We got seated, and it took at least 20 minutes for our server to come over. Ordered coffees and bread, and the bread order came out incorrectly (wasn't even a difficult order), and the coffees came out cold and late. Putting in our food order took another 30 minutes, and the food took an hour to come out. The food was prepared well, but the portions were laughably small, smaller than the last time we came. I'm not that difficult to please (look at my other reviews if you don't believe me) but Zola Bistro is unacceptably bad. We will not be returning. A late breakfast should not take 2 hours.

Yelp.text: My expectations were pretty low for this place given that it's sort of unassuming and sandwiched between a liquor store and a hobby store. The three times...
I have noticed this restaurant several times. Today I stopped and went in. It is definitely a take-out or delivery spot. One young lady worked alone. I...
I've ordered from here a couple of times now and they make it perfectly every time! The texture of the crepes are perfect. Not rubbery at all and I highly...

Google.text:
Recently visited Crepe Nation.  Very difficult to find as their sign is very small and hard to see and read from the road. I asked for what is a popular breakfast item.  I was referred to the classic.  The Classic has a crepe with egg, bacon, cheese and avocado inside.

I is served in what I would describe a small pizza type cardboard box.  I had to wait a bit which was fine.  You enter and there is a counter with a menu up on the wall behind.  There are no tables to sit at here.  It is take out only.  Maybe in the Summer they have two tables outside.

The crepe itself tasted great.  However, the bacon in side was what I would term raw barely heated.  I worry that you could get trichinosis. The cheese is piled in one spot.  It should be spread out more.  The avocado is like one slice cut up in a few pieces.  After seeing the bacon the way it was I took it home and cooked it until it was crisp.  Red not pink.  I was surprised that it was tasteless.  Never have I had bacon that had no taste.  Often when you eat this you get a lot of crepe only.  No contents.  On the whole it was very bland.

I hope that their sweet crepes are better.  But I will not be returning.

I had the Pluto chocolate crepe and it was delicious.  Will definitely be stopping back here for a snack.
**Warning these crepes are huge and dangerously delicious highly recommended

The food was delicious! Definitely designed as more of a takeout place and less of a sit down/dine in place. We dined in and discovered they don’t sell coffee - and the tables, chairs aren’t real comfortable: The wait for food was also pretty long as they had a steady stream of takeout/Door Dash/Uber Eats orders coming in. -1 star for the wait and no coffee, but the food was definitely worth the wait. We will order to go next time.

I recently stopped in to try them out, it was not a great experience at all. I got a white chocolate berry crepe, which was $10.38, only to get NO WHITE CHOCOLATE, went in asked about it was told she put it in the middle, so then I unrolled it to find the white chocolate, and there was nothing. Went back inside to get a side of it so they don't have to remake it was given a side of maple syrup a then told there was no white chocolate, so what did I get? Cause it isn't what I ordered, I will spread word of this as one recently opened in Lansing and I do not enjoy people who are not honest in how they do business. White chocolate is white chocolate and is what makes the price of the item so expensive, maple syrup is cheap and I do not appreciate my hard earned money being manipulated in that aspect as seeing as this was my first time and I will never be back.
Delicious crepes, good portion size and reasonable prices!  A great stop after visiting the arboretum.

Yelp.text: This was my favorite Indian buffet place back when I was in college. It's been years since I've been here and I was unsure if things would be as amazing as...
This place used to be super good. They took my favorite dish off the menu which is a major bummer. If you are sensitive to spice I would order no spice,...
This is a different review tonight.  Had a friend in town on business.  They wanted some fine Indian cuisine, of course my go to has been Madras hands down....

Google.text: Everything on the menu is great. Some of the appetizers you can tell are re-made after being frozen but they're still really good. They do an exceptional job with any chicken menu items, nice people, works fast even when busy, and have decent seating.

Honestly the food itself and the portions are good. The reason for this review is because they did not update their physical menus with their current prices so our table got blindsided when we saw our bills and saw more expensive entrees. Beware when you come here!

Excellent place.  few of my friends n I went  here and we loved to food.

Really friendly staff and good service.

Little more attention to cleaning is required.   Overall I simply loved the place. Can't wait to try it again when. I am there next time

This place has been an old standby for the five years I've lived in the area. Lots of reliably tasty dishes, reasonable middle-of-the-road prices by Ann Arbor standards, and a pretty wide variety. I really like the chili paneer and, of course, their mango lassis are fire.

I've tried over 20 menu items and there hasn't been a single dud so far. Very flavorful and good portion sizes - most of the main dishes can last me two meals. I've only gotten takeout because of the pandemic, and it's always been ready on time.

indian.name: Aroma Indian Cuisine - Ann Arbor
indian.address: 221 W Liberty St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104

Yelp.text:
I came in with a group of four yesterday.
We were greeted and seated by Elton. He was very quick to grab us some water and make some recommendations of...

I wrote an in depth review on Google that may be helpful to you.
All and all a good CARRY OUT restaurant. 
I felt the dine in experience was good only...

Strongly recommended. This place is really good.

Our dining-out habit has been in hibernation for the past two years (Surprise!), and we really miss things...

Google.text:
HIGHLY recommend this spot! Priscilla is absolutely amazing & the food is delicious! She made our experience wonderful with her top notch service & friendly personality! The restaurant was SO busy but she never stoped smiling & everyone loved that!! She did such an excellent job taking care of everyone!!
Priscilla is unforgettable and because of her & my tasty dinner, I now have a new favorite place to go to when I come home to visit! Thank you Aroma, you now have a customer for life & thank you so much for sharing your beautiful heart Priscilla :)

READ ALL B4 DECIDE.
If you want carry out Indian cuisine,  get it here. IF DINE IN, not the best place if you want real silverware, plates, glasses etc. WAS A HUGE TURN OFF..  Paper plates, plastic containers with your food. TOO MANY other Indian restaurants in A2 to dine in. I would order out from Aroma, but not dine in again.
Atmosphere is 0
Welcome is 0 (waited was very welcoming later)
Cleanliness 8
Food authentic 10
Food quality 8
Waiter (Elton) 10
Prices 7 (everything seems to hover at $15.99)
Portions 6

Elton made the experience good.

Great! Me and the family drive an hour just to eat here. The food is some of the best Indian food around and the location is super nice. However if you are someone who does not like eating out of paper plates or plastic spoons I'd recommend doing carry out instead.

I've had Indian food all over the US and this is one of the best. Very unassuming at first glance, but the proof is in their cooking. The waiter, Elton, was incredibly friendly and even shared his private stash of spicy pickle with us which was out of this world. The chef, Kartchik, did an amazing job with our entrees... the flavor and spice level were perfect. Looks like this will be a go-to spot for us when we visit Ann Arbor

The menu lacks detail with regard to ingredients. It is not very helpful for those who want vegan options or have dietary restrictions. The food took an extra 40 minutes of wait time in the car past the scheduled pickup time. The portions were small given the cost of each meal. The butter chicken was OK. We ordered one meal medium spicy and two mild. The ones that were supposed to be mild were more spicy than the medium one, forcing us to prepare last minute separate food for our toddler. The potatoes in both vegetable dishes were still hard and not yet cooked properly. Will not be ordering from this place again.

Yelp.text: They open to start taking orders at 4 pm and you are given a pickup slot when you order. We ordered carry out at about 4:15 on a Friday night and our pickup...
The food is really good. The atmosphere was awesome. I had some salad it was delicious. The Tikka masala was so good super super good that it was delicious....

Ordered carry out last week and I don't know if I got them on an off night but it was just a little lacking. 

I ordered the chicken tikka masala, chicken...

Google.text: Delicious food that tasted fresh. Staff were very kind and enthusiastic although I arrived to get my food a few minutes after closing. Tandoori chicken was perfectly moist and a bit spicy. The samosas and sauces were perfect. Rice and seasonings were wonderfully fragrant and full of flavor. Only thing I would change is that one could make notes when making an order online. For example, would be nice to add a note to an item that I order to not have onion due to allergy. Still, I'm very excited to have tried this restaurant and want to try more of their dishes!

Flavor, heat, signature cocktails were all amazing 🤩 I also very much appreciate the level of labeling for food restrictions and dietary needs. Everything was clearly labeled for gluten. I noticed they also had good labeling for vegetarian and vegan options.

I'm so happy I showed up in Ann Arbor just in time for them to open up to inside dining.

Delicious food but service needs lots of improvements. The bartender was rushing the customers the whole time, very impatient when taking the order and then got the order wrong, asked me if I am done with the food in the middle and gave me a box, delivered the check even before the main entree is severed. I like the food but would not recommend it to people unless you just want to buy take out.

Absolutely the best Indian cuisine. The food is delicious, fresh. Ingredients are listed so those with any allergies or whom prefer Vegan, can order with confidence. I think they have adapted well during this pandemic. When it comes to the very best in Indian cuisine, I put Cardamom at the top of the list!

No option to change time or pick up order. I want my order an hour from now. I called restaurant but went to voicemail. Inbox full. Very disappointed. I am writing this to raise the owners awareness. I will change review when they fix this or pick up phone

indian.name: Taste of India
indian.address: 217 S State St, Ste B, Ann Arbor, MI 48104

Yelp.text: We needed to grab a quick bite before a show. This place looked relatively empty on a Saturday night and we had never been there before so we decided to...
Best Indian food in Ann Arbor hands down. I love their butter chicken, malai kofta, naan, garlic naan, Kashmiri naan, all of their vegetarian dishes and...
Lamb house special curry (hot) : it was pretty good! My friend has a good spice tolerance, but this was still pretty spicy for him, although...

Google.text: Excellent food and service.  Not sure why this place does not have higher ratings. Every time we eat here it is delicious and wonderful.   Truly a taste of India.  Keep up the good work.   See you again for sure.
Great food. Decent price. However our server told us that unless you leave a tip in cash, they don't see a penny of it.

The meals at this restaurant are exceptional. I go as often as I am able. The might be the best curry in town. The balance of spice and flavor is perfect. I definitely hydrate well after eating here. It's a dining experience worthy of praise. I can't wait to go back.
Delicious food and so many great options to choose from. Quick to being out order and it was hot and fresh.
Had to drive back 20 minutes to pick up the rest of my order but the food is always very good.

indian.address: 400 S Division St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104

Yelp.text: Great dinner! Everything was so flavorful and they had a large variety of traditional cuisine that I have not seen elsewhere! I'll be back!!
Very delicious and authentic food. The inside is a bit dated and they are definitely suffering from being short staffed but our food came out very quickly....
I live near Namaste Flavors and every day I walk past and smell the aromas that drift out of the restaurant, and it makes me so hungry each time. I finally...

Google.text: Have ordered take out many times.  Today, we dined in.  If it were possible to give 10 stars , I would.  One of the staff said, “we love food… food is healing”.  Well stated!   They know food and want you to enjoy.  Don’t hesitate to ask for help if you’re new to Indian food.  Delightful flavors and perfect preparation.   Full Stop * why no artsy photos?  Cause it’s so good, we all dove in!

The food is very good, but they consistently have clover estimate 20 min for your food to be ready and it's usually closer to an hour (but sometimes 20 min so you can't just wait or your food will be cold). They also always just give the excuse "they are busy" when asked why your food is taking so long. I've been here once a month or so for about a year, so this isn't a one time thing. If they gave accurate time estimates, they'd be 5 star for me!

Went here for dinner for the first time last night. The gentleman who seated us and waited on our table was very helpful. My wife and I are both whole food plant based vegans and not being very knowledgeable  of what ingredients are in Indian food, we weren't sure what we could eat. He took the time to explain to us what was vegan and also gave us some ideas for dishes that they could make vegan. We were considering a vegetable biryani but he made sure we knew that butter was used in cooking it. We were very happy with the service! There was four of us dining together and every dish we ordered was delicious. We will definitely be eating there again!

I absolutely LOVE the food here! We had an issue with getting the correct orders at our table. But we went during Hash Bash so I'm sure they had a lot of takeout orders at the same time so were busy. LOOVE love their food. High quality with some incredible authentic Indian cuisine!
Amazing food with amazing service; Namaste does not disappoint! Food was really good. Tasted like food I had in India. There is south Indian and North Indian food available. Both taste pretty good

Yelp.text: Both the lamb biryari and chicken curry were good. The lamb biryani was in medium spice level and for someone who has high tolerance to spicy food, medium...

Google.text: I've never had Ethiopian food before, but my husband rants and raves about it all the time. So last weekend when we were in Lansing, we decided to try it.  For those who are unfamiliar like I was, they really don't use utensils.  You can request them if you really want to, but I recommend diving in head first and eat like they do. They give you this sourdough spongy bread that you use to pick up your food (the menu explains it all).  The spices they used are amazing and reminded me of a cross between Indian and Thai spices. Everything we ordered was delicious.  We did a shareable of three veggies and two meats, all spicy of course. They have mild, too. But honestly, the spicy isn't overpowering. It's just enough to say hello.  Try at least ONE spicy thing just for the flavor. I can't wait to make up another excuse to go to Lansing and try more things from Altu's.

The spicy is pretty spicy if you don't like heat, probably a medium. Ask for hot sauce if you like it extra spicy. Our service was excellent!

Hot darn it’s good. I highly recommend the Intore with the Peanut-Stewed Spinach and Coconut Rice—but I’ve heard amazing things about the other options and dishes. I don’t think you can go wrong here. If you’re put off by the peanut in the Peanut-Stewed Spinach, it is pretty subtle and compliments the rest of the dish very well.

Additionally, great atmosphere and nice people. I’ve dined in and done take out and both were very tasty.

Waited 20 minutes for my takeout order on the first visit, but food was good, so decided to give it another shot. Waited 30+ minutes the second time. Considering that this restaurant a) is not cheap, b) is very highly regarded, and c) has online ordering where you specify what time you're coming to pickup, I feel like the long wait time is not okay. Both times, the staff didn't bother to address/explain the delay. We ordered two signature dishes and made the order WAY in advance, so it's not like we were being difficult customers. I will say that the food has a comforting home-cooked feel and a special wholesome quality. I also appreciated that they honored my request to replace the rice with beans. However, we just don't have the time (or honestly, the patience) to wait half an hour for a takeout order these days. There are so many other exciting new restaurants in Detroit now, and we probably won't be returning to this one, unfortunately.

Oh my God, the kumuahana is incredible. The creamy, child corn salad, the warm comforting yellow beans, and the flame grilled chicken were nothing short of delightful.

And they have PASSION FRUIT JUICE.

I COULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE ENOUGH.

I ate here for the second time tonight. My husband had the goat shank, and we also tried a side of the flash fried fish and the spinach with peanuts. Every single thing I have tasted here is incredible. It's more than just delicious- it's an experience. The spices are all so warm and comforting- especially appreciated in this chilly weather. The spiced coffee and avocado-passion fruit pudding is a wonderful way to end a meal. We also had a chance to speak with the owner who was very kind and obviously motivated to share his story and culture. From what I understood,  he thinks we Americans are living too fast, and this affects all aspects of our lives from raising children to enjoying food. He said that you have to put as much time into your food as the pleasure and quality you want to get out of it. Hearing the story of how the restaurant came to be was very interesting- I suggested that he write a cookbook that also tells his story, and/or even teach classes. I would LOVE to learn how to cook like this. If he decides to teach, I will be ready to learn.

How can I put it? I guess I have to start with my thoughts on the location. When I first got to Detroit 3 years ago people told me I came at just the right time. Not too long ago the city had installed street lights and it seemed things were moving in a positive direction. I drove up and down Woodward and noticed this block had some shuttered businesses. I thought it was such a shame being so close to the truly inspiring Fischer building a few hundred feet away and having a desolate block such as this sitting here. I remember seeing that something had popped up, it had eye catching designs on the windows and seemed to be some kind of eatery and I paid it no mind until this place was mentioned in Eater Detroit as one of the city’s up and coming gems. The branding is fantastic. The decor is inviting and sleek. The atmosphere is electric. The staff was very pleasant and there were smiles all around. It seemed like not only was this amazing corner spot being filled but it was occupied with an establishment that would be here to stay. Finally, we ordered our dishes. As excited as I was about the demeanor of the restaurant nothing could have prepared me for such an incredible disarming plate. I felt like I was back at home, I grew up eating Afro-Caribbean cuisine. This type of food was very similar to what I had in my youth but of course just a bit different. I had the marinated chicken with yellow beans, rice pilau, and plantains. The plantains were exceptional and clearly made by someone who knows what good plantains are supposed to taste like. The chicken was perfect. Flavorful, hot, and tender. I could easily eat the yellow beans every day and never tire of them. My partner had never tried anything like this and most of our meal was in silence, we were blown away. I’m writing this no less than 15 minutes after we exited the restaurant. If you’re wondering whether or not to go out in this (at the time) frigid February weather, put on your coat and boots. Warm up the car. Head to baobab fare and thank me later. One of the best restaurants in Detroit hands down and honestly I’d say top three in the city. Look out, you got yourself a couple of new regulars.

UPDATE (01/21) - AWESOME.  I was selected to participated in the shipping program where they ship menu items to you.  They apply some form of coolant (like dry ice) and cold packs and ship to you via UPS.  I got it shortly after shipping and it was still nearly ice cold.  Wonderfully packed.  Food was vacuum sealed and labeled.  Just as good as in the restaurant!  Thanks, Kola!

Food: 7/10. The jollof was really good and the jerk chicken as well. What lowers the score is the meat pie. It was either old or came from the frozen section. It did not taste fresh at all and was very bland.

Atmosphere: 5/10: There was some jams that was played but it was blaring loud! I could barely have a conversation with the people I came with. We basically had to yell at each other. The lighting was weird and also the set up of the restaurant.  It was kind of confusing when we walked in because there was no host.

Customer Service: 3/10. The waitress made very rude comments. Please understand that not every enjoys “sarcasm.” She was rude and made us feel uncomfortable. No bill was provided which I thought was odd. I’ve never been to a restaurant that did not provide a bill.  When someone from my party went to the register to request it, no one was there. Also the waitress kept sniffling and I saw her coughing multiple times. Please stay at home if you’re sick. I think we should know that by now after dealing with a pandemic!

The vibe was nice at Kolas! The team was kind, attentive, and fun.  The food came out hot and fresh.  The drinks were to our liking.  This wasn’t our first time and we will be back.  Music by Mello is always a treat.

Man, I’ve been wanting to try African food for quite some time. So for my birthday my sister gifted me money for a African meal. So I did my research and found this restaurant. It was only three minutes away, I  was so excited .I didn’t read the reviews which was a  huge mistake.However, I ordered my food came home to what I thought would be a birthday treat.The food was old reheated and cold.I was so DISAPPOINTED..
Went to the Bob celebration. I went to NYE 2021-2022 and the egusi soup was terrific.  My Dominica friend loved it but she ate it with a fork.  That is a big no-no.

Yelp.text: You must have to try this place!! The food is awesome!! The tortilla de harina is one of the best in the menu. I love this restaurante!!

Google.text: What an amazing little place! It may not look like much on the outside, but the food is incredible and extremely authentic. The waitress is so kind and generous with her time. Love this place!
I had the fried fish, it was delicious and service was excellent. Usually I rarely post reviews, but I have to acknowledge the quality of the food I had here! Excellent!
What an incredible spot! Definitely my favorite restaurant I have found in the A²/Ypsi area. One of the most affordable spots around and the food is always phenomenal.
The staff was amazing! The food was delicious! And it was inexpensive. Highly recommended!

Their food is simply the best!! This is my new favorite restaurant. I 100% recommend! Their prices are amazing and so is their food. There is nothing to not like about it. And the people there are just so nice! 10/10

The long picnic style tables are accommodating for any party size. Walk in, stand in line, order, and then the food and drinks are delivered to the table....

Google.text: Absolutely loved this restaurant!  Passing through on a business trip and a colleague recommended we stop here.   I had the chicken Frita with an egg and the salsa toppers.  Everything had great flavor and was freshly made.  I tried the guac. and the fried plantains...both delicious!  Inside was clean and bright. Staff was very polite.  It was really busy, but we did not wait too long for the food.

Casual flair and a unique Cuban menu make this spot great.  Everything we tried was delicious and different from other Ann Arbor offerings.  Would recommend stopping by when you're looking for food just off the main street scene.

The best burgers!! They have lots of options to fit any preference. The fries are great. We loved the churro. Staff is always friendly. It is loud on weekend nights. You order before you sit down and then by the time you get through line there will be a table open. They have it done to a science there! The seats are all benches and not handicap friendly or baby friendly.

My son is home for Spring Break and we drove to Ann Arbor to have an AMAZING lunch!  We loved the Frita and the lime fries.  Miranda was very welcoming and Evan was super attentive to our needs.  We can’t wait to bring the rest of the family. Thanks for having us!

Updated review:
We have been coming here for 8 years now and past few months we had very bad experience everytime. I am not sure if it was just us, but I appreciate someone taking time to talk to us and trying to address issue. Today’s order was made perfectly hence I am updating this from 1 star to 5 star again. Hopefully they continue to provide good service like they did in past.

Google.text:
The food was good, but it wasn't anything to write home about. I felt that each dish was missing one or two elements that would have led to them really standing out. Additionally, some components of dishes actively made the dining experience more difficult. The tortillas served with the queso fundido are a bit too small, and I felt that one or two more would be a welcome addition.

The service was acceptable, and it wasn't bad in any particular way. However I would have appreciated if it was slightly more attentive. But then again maybe this goes a bit against their upscale street food ethos.

After several visits, I have been shown fast and friendly service by staff that appear happy to be there. Excellent menu and drink options served quickly and friendly. I've added it to one of my regular stops.

Good food, watered down drinks!
The day we went for dinner there was only one bartender for the entire restaurant, so my drink arrived after I finished my food(~1hr from order). The food was good and they have good vegetarian options as well!
I would go back when it's not busy and they get their bar situation sorted.

Seems to be the only non-overrated restaurant in Ann Arbor. Not amazing but overall an enjoyable environment to sit in on a weekend night, the best I've experienced so far in AA. Service is very good. Draws a comely crowd as well.

I was able to order some gluten free nachos, which were good. They didn't list olives as something that came on the nachos but there were A LOT on there. Which was fine, just FYI to others. I also had a frozen blood orange margarita that was really good. Our server, Ahmed, was very kind and gracious while juggling a lot of work during a busy time. He deserves a raise!

Google.text: Perfectly encapsulates what great food should be. Every dish is superb and made with great care, ingredients are fresh and top notch, and the staff are genuinely kind and loving people. Every item on the menu will treat you well, but make sure to always get plantains because they put every other plantain in Michigan to shame.

Delicious, friendly and had great vegan options. I had this on my list to try for a while and glad I finally made a visit. I placed my order when I got there and didn't have to wait very long. The salad and sauce provided a great compliment to filling tamales. I will be back!
Absolutely delicious. Lots of gluten free options. Thank you so much for making wonderful and safe options. Highly recommend.

Spain in Michigan... YES!! Aventura has been on my bucket list and finally got to try it tonight. I recommend reservations as this place gets busy. 

We...

Google.text:
The ambience here is overall very good, though some evenings it can be almost too crowded and noisy for conversation at the table.
Food is good, though don't expect large servings. I've had better food at similar prices and similar serving sizes, but we still return regularly to this restaurant before operas/plays at U of M. Nice wine selection run by a knowledgeable wine director, whose recommendations were spot on with our meal.

Right away the brick wall with moss sets the tone for a great night out. Our waiter was knowledgable and friendly and steered us towards the paella. We ordered the paella, which was delicious, and our favourite was the octopus. The goat cheese and pineapple dish was also very good. The drinks were fantastic and strong. This was a great restaurant for an anniversary dinner!

The food is absolutely excellent here! Especially the churros with the chocolate and caramel sauce (I think it was caramel). I like that it’s tapas style but you gotta make sure to have lots of money with you to go here because it is not cheap! Seriously you can easily rack up a high bill just off of appetizers. Overall I will highly recommend this restaurant!!

Great food and drinks, I would like to come back with an empty stomach for their paellas. Would recommend and definitely go back. Minor hitch - there was no hostess for about 6 minutes since we arrived. But she quickly took care of us once she was back.

I had been waiting to go to Aventura for years, hearing good things from friends and coworkers, and finally found time to go. The biggest thing that I had heard from friends was to stick to the tapas and skip the paella. As a paella fan, I decided that I needed to try it. This proved to be a mistake

We got the Valentine's Day menu, which included a few tapas (you don't get to choose), and the lobster paella, followed by a dessert.

One thing to note here is that the drinks and wine selection are really excellent. Can't fault them there.

The tapas we received were really disappointing. The bruschetta tasted like the tomatoes came from a can, there was another forgettable vegetarian dish, and the third dish was a fried cheese dish. On the whole,  definitely nothing to write home about.

The most unfortunate portion of the entire meal was the lobster paella. The rice in the paella was mostly flavorless, the calamari was decent, but the lobster was extremely overcooked. I've never had lobster this dry. It was a real shame.

The dessert was some chocolate souffle, fine but also forgettable.

For the price, the quality of food is not there. Aventura is all form and no function. It's regrettable because the space is gorgeous and I really wanted to like the food. Spanish food is really fantastic. I've been to Spain. I've had Tapas. It's really not that difficult to do well. Aventura simply was not. I hope that they can work to improve their menu because they are onto a good concept, just severely lacking in execution.

Yelp.text:
This place is amazing!  Tried 3 dishes and all of them were great. The service was extremely friendly and prices were cheap.  

Authentic all the way.

Delicious Cuban food that is my new go-to! The guava pastry is amazingly similar to Porto's guava pastry, but delicious in its own right - same goes for the...

Google.text: I very much enjoyed this place. Having moved from Miami to Detroit, it was great to have something familiar and authentic. The ambience was enjoyable and the food was delicious, with flavorful coffee to finish. The manager came out to speak with us and the wait staff was super friendly. I highly recommend this location for anyone looking to enjoy authentic Cuban food.

If you haven’t tried this place yet you’re sleeping 😂 the food is amazing, the place is always clean, the manager and staff has always been super nice and cool, and overall it’s just a real chill place. I pretty much go everyday for lunch and the yucca fries 🔥🔥🔥🤩. Prices are very reasonable to folks go check em out I promise you won’t be disappointed in the flavor 👌🏾

Great Cuban food in Michigan. The long wait for their opening was well worth it. The food was served very hot and perfect. I haven’t had a real authentic Cuban food nowhere in Michigan just like you would in Miami. I highly recommend. The owner is very nice and friendly as well as the staff. They’re very welcoming and very attentive. I wish I could give more than five stars
We REALLY enjoyed our meal here; delicious food and a very inviting atmosphere plus the whole place is super clean. We’ll 1000% be back! 🙂

Amazing fresh delicious.....plus a bunch of other descriptive words that I can't come up with right now.....this place is outstanding!!!!  Best Cuban food I've had!!!  Which isn't a ton....but oh my!!!!  We started with the plantain chips with rojo sauce....when the server delivered it he said let me know if you need more sauce ......YES PLEASE!!!! We also had the Yuka fries....I loved them!!!  The cilantro sauce was was great!!!  I had their steak sandwich....super tasty!!!  The bread was fresh....everything was perfect!!!  My husband ordered some beef dish that came with rice and that is what hit all the flavors out of the park!!!!  We will most definitely be back here.....and you all should go support them and see what their food is all about!!!!  We also had the sugarcane juice.....I highly recommend it!!!  Perfect drink to go with the amazing flavors!!!!

Google.text: This is place is absolutely amazing!  I had their chicken quesadillas and it was my first time patronizing this establishment.  I am officially a loyal customer.  I've already began telling people that I know to visit. Their very nice and the good is great. I was having a bit of a headache so I went to my car to wait for the food to be prepared and one of their king employees brought my food to me and offered very friendly conversation.  I love it!

Today was my first time trying this place, I ordered a fish burrito. Once home I opened the foil to find a massive burrito predominantly filled with beans and rice, only a very tiny little strip of white fish (only one) in the center. Who wants a big bean and rice burrito for $15?? I will never return to this place. What a ripoff!

Hands down one of the best meals in Ann Arbor!  Just go!  By the time your eating your meal, the world shrinks down to this amazing place where you realize that the food is better than anything you've had in a long time!  Chef Jeff is the man!

Another delicious dinner from Cosa Sabrosa! After living in the Southwest we have craved quality and authentic Mexican food here in Michigan & found it at Cosa Sabrosa! Chef Jeff has this menu dialed in!

I ordered a couple fish tacos and smoked chicken Pozole yesterday... it was so good I ordered three fish tacos before I headed into work today!! Everything is so delicious and fresh. I highly recommend the verde sauce. I can't wait to come here for live music and tacos one day. This place came recommended to me by the owner's father, when I served him at another local restaurant. I told him I would stop by the next day, and I am so so glad I did!

Google.text: Crust is great. The texture is perfect, the taste is very good. The sauce is good. The proportions are very good. However, the flavor is lacking, both in intensity and complexity. Overall the slice of pizza is good, but it's missing the flavors of NY and New England pizza.

I never experienced Joe's in New York, but in terms of Ann Arbor pizza it's pretty good! A bit pricey, but at this point if you get food at AA you should expect that. My go to if I'm super hungry is two supreme slices, though a slice of cheese does the trick of you're on a budget. On Friday or Saturday nights, expect the place to be packed. Masks are mandated (as with most on campus establishments). Overall I recommend.
